intro: Cynoglossum subalpinum, commonly known as alpine tongue-shaped flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
